page.title: 09THE BUTCHERS BARN
page.content: IN THE VILLAGE OF URCHFONT THERE IS A RECONSTRUCTED WOODEN, THATCHED ROOFED BARN WHICH HAS CAREFULLY BEEN REBUILT BY IT'S OWNER MR FORD THE BUTCHER, WHO FOUND THE ORIGINAL 14TH CENTURY BARN ON FIRE ON AUGUST 25TH 1983. THE CAUSE OF THE FIRE HAS REMAINED A MYSTERY. MR FORD AND 3 FELLOW CRAFTSMEN, STUDIED THE STRUCTURE AND TYPES OF WOODS USED IN THE ORIGINAL BUILDING AND AS NEAR AS POSSIBLE HAVE REBUILT TO THE ORIGINAL DESIGN. THIS TOOK 9 MONTHS OF HARD WORKAND SEARCHING FOR CORRECT TIMBERS. THE BARN,ONCE USED TO SHELTER FARM ANIMALS IS NOW A VILLAGE AMENITY AND THOUGH NOT IN COMPETITION WITH THE VILLAGE HALL HAS A SIMILAR USEFUL FUNCTION FOR FUND RAISING EVENTS AND SPECIAL OCCASIONS.
